OrgName.entry: PEER ACTIVITIES IN SEXUAL HEALTH PROJECT

Desc.entry: Young people's sexual health, peer education project. PASH volunteeers (aged 16-19 years) receive training to support them in the delivery of school-based education sessions and informal young people's settings. Volunteers are recruited from many settings, including schools and colleges. PASH is co-ordinated through the Centre for HIV and Sexual Health (Sheffield Primary Care Trust).

ContactName.entry: Liz Murray, Sexual Health Promotion Specialist

ProviderServiceDetails.entry: Mon-Fri 9am-5pm (office times); various times for the activities, please contact for details
